definition: to travel around the country (as itinerant peddler or entertainer)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to make a living as a traveling performer etc
to roam far and wide/to drift with the wind

rivers and lakes/all corners of the country/remote areas to which hermits retreat/section of society operating independently of mainstream society, out of reach of the law/the milieu in which wuxia tales play out (cf. 武俠|武侠[wu3 xia2])/(in late imperial times) world of traveling merchants, itinerant doctors, fortune tellers etc/demimonde/(in modern times) triads/secret gangster societies/underworld
to regard the four corners of the world all as home (idiom)/to feel at home anywhere/to roam about unconstrained/to consider the entire country, or world, to be one's own
true hero of Greenwood (refers to popular hero in Robin Hood style)
folk art consisting of storytelling to music
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to break into a house for robbery (idiom)
